com.att.research.xacml.std

Class StdMutableStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.std.StdMutableStatus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Status
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JaxpStatus

    public class StdMutableStatus
extends java.lang.Object
implements Status
    Mutable implementation of the Status interface to represent a XACML Status element.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StdMutableStatus()
      Creates an empty StdMutableStatus.
      StdMutableStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableStatus with the given StatusCode, a null status message and no StatusDetail.
      StdMutableStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn, java.lang.String statusMessageIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableStatus with the given StatusCode, String status message and no StatusDetail.
      StdMutableStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn, java.lang.String statusMessageIn, StatusDetail statusDetailIn)
      Creates a new StdMutableStatus with the given StatusCode, String status message, and StatusDetail.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static StdMutableStatus copy(Status status)
      Creates a new StdMutableStatus that is a copy of the given Status.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the Status interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Status objects (s1 and s2) are equal if: s1.getStatusCode().equals(s2.getStatusCode()) AND s1.getStatusMessage() == null && s2.getStatusMessage() == null OR s1.getStatusMessage().equals(s2.getStatusMessage()) s1.getStatusDetail() == null && s2.getStatusDetail() == null OR s1.getStatusDetail().equals(s2.getStatusDetail())
      StatusCode getStatusCode()
      Gets the StatusCode for this Status.
      StatusDetail getStatusDetail()
      Gets the StatusDetail associated with this Status if there is any.
      java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
      Gets the String status message for this Status.
      boolean isOk()
      Returns true if the StatusCode for this Status is the XACML OK value.
      Status merge(Status status)
      Returns a Status with the same StatusCode and status message as this Status but whose StatusDetail is the merging of the StatusDetail in this Status and the StatusDetail in the given Status.
      void setStatusCode(StatusCode statusCodeIn)
      Sets the StatusCode representing the XACML StatusCode for the Status represented by this StdMutableStatus.
      void setStatusDetail(StatusDetail statusDetailIn)
      Sets the StatusDetail representing the XACML StatusDetail for the Status represented by this StdMutableStatus.
      void setStatusMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Sets the String representing the XACML StatusMessage for the Status represented by this StdMutableStatus.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: Status
        Implementations of the Status interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Status objects (s1 and s2) are equal if: s1.getStatusCode().equals(s2.getStatusCode()) AND s1.getStatusMessage() == null && s2.getStatusMessage() == null OR s1.getStatusMessage().equals(s2.getStatusMessage()) s1.getStatusDetail() == null && s2.getStatusDetail() == null OR s1.getStatusDetail().equals(s2.getStatusDetail())
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Status
        Overrides:
